intro: Leptomeria axillaris, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its foliage is usually low-growing and features hairy, narrow leaves adapted to its arid environment.
